scenes.title: Deleting Instagram, finding focus
scenes.main_point: Removing Instagram freed time and attention for intentional reading.
scenes.scene_summary: After deleting Instagram, I gained time, energy, and attention to read intentionally.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
One person at home in a quiet corner, holding a book while their phone shows Instagram deleted.
They settle into an intentional reading moment, calm and focused.

scenes.title: Curiosity-led reading and Feynman’s warning
scenes.main_point: Curiosity guided a daily one-hour reading habit, anchored by Feynman’s principle.
scenes.scene_summary: I read by curiosity for one hour daily, and Feynman warned: don’t fool yourself.
key_elements: Two books: The Beginning of Infinity; Ego is the Enemy
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A person sits at a simple reading setup at home, starting a one-hour timer.
Two books lie open/stacked: “The Beginning of Infinity” and “Ego is the Enemy,” while a Richard Feynman quote “Don’t fool yourself” appears on screen.

scenes.title: How high ego fooled me
scenes.main_point: High ego distorted reality, blocked beginnerhood, and softened into growth through humility.
scenes.scene_summary: High ego made me dodge beginner work, until rejection pushed me to learn and improve.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A person with hesitant hands holds a guitar while a kid nearby plays guitar better, in a casual practice space; the person looks humbled.
On a laptop, a hackathon rejection message sits beside open no-code tools, as the person begins learning.

scenes.title: Bad explanations vs good explanations
scenes.main_point: Seeking good explanations and humility prevented self-deception more than easy beliefs did.
scenes.scene_summary: Bad explanations thrived under authority; asking harder questions kept me humble and learning.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A lone reader at a desk flips through David Deutsch book pages while writing in a notebook of questions.
On the wall, a simple Galileo heliocentric sketch and cosmic imagery with question marks, a tiny Earth in the vast universe; mood: humble curiosity.
